Let me seperate the recommendation into 2 parts:
- If you've never played the first part of Portal: I'd recommend you to play the first part first to understand the beginning of Portal 2. Portal is less complicated than Portal 2 and it will let you understand the whole game orientation.
- If you already played Portal: Portal 2 has got new traps/hurdles, bigger maps, more test chambers and much better story. Totally recommended!!!
So about the co-op mode: It's much more fun, you need much more iq. Make the tests and save those humans!!

----------------

Portal 2 is the most incredible game I have ever played. Hands down. Story is excellent. Graphics are great. Gameplay is smooth and easy. And that's just the start.
The game continues after the first game... but a long time in the future. You explore what happened after the first game and the history of Aperture, in an exceptional and creative way, leading to a climactic end. The story alone is amazing.
However Gameplay is also much improved over Portal. Portal 2 offers new ways of using portals, the portals feel smoother and physics is improved. Movement controls also feel faster and more responsive, leading to an overall better experience.
The Graphics of this game are also amazing. Clearly well thought out and designed, each level feels and looks amazing, with it feeling that ray-tracing is already in this game. Good job Valve!
Overall, Portal 2 is a visual and storytelling masterpiece and needs to be played by everyone, even if you aren't a great fan of puzzle games. Trust me, this one is great.
Portal 2 gets a 10/10.

For more reviews check my Steam profile
Hope you enjoyed my review, god bless you

awesome plot, great gameplay. loved the two player version.

Got this and portal 1, both of them was on sale for $2 each. Absolutely worth the money, the story and gameplay was enjoyable, voice acting here was very impressive, less of a thriller and more action when compared to the first game (not that I disliked that). The puzzles themselves are a bit challenging but a bit of time and observation can get you through them.
